unnormalised: ### When the Marksheet Reads Like a Comedy Script: My Academic Saga
normalised: ### When the Marksheet Reads Like a Comedy Script: My Academic Saga

unnormalised: So, the results are out. Again. And let me tell you, my marksheets have always been a source of amusement, mostly to others, and occasionally to myself, after a strong cup of chai. This time was no different. I preponed my disappointment, logged into the portal, and braced myself.
normalised: So, the results are out. Again. And let me tell you, my marksheets have always been a source of amusement, mostly to others, and occasionally to myself, after a strong cup of chai. This time was no different. I preponed my disappointment, logged into the portal, and braced myself.

unnormalised: First up: Maths. 38/100. I swear, numbers and I have a complicated relationship. It's like trying to understand why aunty next door insists on telling everyone your business. I'm pretty sure the examiner took pity; otherwise, I'd be staring at a big fat 0, which, by the way, is the number of times I've understood calculus in its entirety. #MathsIsMyNemesis #ThankGodForGraceMarks
normalised: First up: Maths. thirty eight divided by one hundred. I swear, numbers and I have a complicated relationship. It's like trying to understand why aunty next door insists on telling everyone your business. I'm pretty sure the examiner took pity; otherwise, I'd be staring at a big fat zero, which, by the way, is the number of times I've understood calculus in its entirety. hash Maths Is My Nemesis hash Thank God For Grace Marks

unnormalised: Then there's Physics: 42/100. A slight improvement, perhaps because I managed to correctly draw a circuit diagram that looked vaguely like the Taj Mahal. I'm not sure. Maybe the examiner had just had a good day. I am hoping it's that! But I am pretty sure that even Newton is facepalming somewhere up there. My mom says, "Beta, at least you passed." Thanks, Mom, that's the equivalent of saying "At least the house didn't burn down completely."
normalised: Then there's Physics: forty two divided by one hundred. A slight improvement, perhaps because I managed to correctly draw a circuit diagram that looked vaguely like the Taj Mahal. I'm not sure. Maybe the examiner had just had a good day. I am hoping it's that! But I am pretty sure that even Newton is facepalming somewhere up there. My mom says, "Beta, at least you passed." Thanks, Mom, that's the equivalent of saying "At least the house didn't burn down completely."

unnormalised: English, my supposed safe haven, yielded a surprising 65/100. Apparently, my creative writing skills peak at crafting elaborate excuses for not submitting assignments on time. The irony isn't lost on me. My lecturer Prof. Sharma did write a note about potential though, maybe I can become a professional blogger at least? My dad would be disappointed but the money is the same!
normalised: English, my supposed safe haven, yielded a surprising sixty five divided by one hundred. Apparently, my creative writing skills peak at crafting elaborate excuses for not submitting assignments on time. The irony isn't lost on me. My lecturer P-r-o-f. Sharma did write a note about potential though, maybe I can become a professional blogger at least? My dad would be disappointed but the money is the same!

unnormalised: Chemistry? A solid 50/100. Neutral. Like a perfectly balanced chemical equation, my feelings towards this subject are nonexistent. I guess I managed to remember enough formulas to not completely embarrass myself. I am pretty sure I could mix some household cleaning products into something dangerous if I wanted too, but so far I have resisted the urge.
normalised: Chemistry? A solid fifty divided by one hundred. Neutral. Like a perfectly balanced chemical equation, my feelings towards this subject are nonexistent. I guess I managed to remember enough formulas to not completely embarrass myself. I am pretty sure I could mix some household cleaning products into something dangerous if I wanted too, but so far I have resisted the urge.

unnormalised: The saving grace? Hindi. A glorious 88/100. Proof that I can, in fact, excel at something. Turns out years of watching Bollywood movies and gossiping with my nani paid off. Who knew? Maybe I should apply for a Bollywood screenplay writer.
normalised: The saving grace? Hindi. A glorious eighty eight divided by one hundred. Proof that I can, in fact, excel at something. Turns out years of watching Bollywood movies and gossiping with my nani paid off. Who knew? Maybe I should apply for a Bollywood screenplay writer.

unnormalised: Overall average: Somewhere in the vicinity of "could be worse, could be better." My parents, surprisingly, didn't disown me (yet). My friends are already planning the "celebratory" party (read: pity party). And me? I'm just here, contemplating the existential dread of another academic year, fuelled by endless cups of chai and the faint hope that maybe, just maybe, next time, the marksheet will read a bit more like a comedy success story, and a bit less like a tragicomedy. #IndianEducationSystem #MarksheetTales
